alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:56PM EST until January 11 at 3:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. For the Swatara Creek...including Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek near Hershey. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The right, or north bank begins to overflow. Several roadways upstream of the gage are affected by high water. At 8.0 feet, The right, or north bank overflows. Several roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:32 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
